comments.author: ed@flexvault.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.18) Gecko/20110614 Firefox/3.6.18
Build ID: 20110614230723

Steps to reproduce:

In https clicked on button (gif) to add item to cart.



Actual results:

2 GETs were send to the web server by FireFox.



Expected results:

Only 1 GETs should have been sent to the web server by FireFox. This only happens with FireFox. It does not happen using Internet Explorer or Google Chrome.
I saw a earlier bug that was resolved, something about needing to double click on icons in https to get a single GET. Maybe this is related to that fix.
comments.text:

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.18) Gecko/20110614 Firefox/3.6.18
Build ID: 20110614230723

Steps to reproduce:

In https clicked on button (gif) to add item to cart.



Actual results:

2 GETs were send to the web server by FireFox.



Expected results:

Only 1 GETs should have been sent to the web server by FireFox. This only happens with FireFox. It does not happen using Internet Explorer or Google Chrome.
I saw a earlier bug that was resolved, something about needing to double click on icons in https to get a single GET. Maybe this is related to that fix.

comments.creator: ed@flexvault.com
comments.author: ed@flexvault.com
comments.raw_text:
Update: I have LORI active, so I added the ENV variable "HTTP_X_LORI_TIME_1" and got 2 GETs with different LORI times. Just in case, I disabled LORI and restarted FireFox, and I still got the double clicks.

This does not happen, if I issue a post.
